{{also|wort|wòrt|wört}} ==German== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|werh₁}} From {{inh|de|gmh|wort}}, from {{inh|de|goh|wort}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*wurdą}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*werdʰo-}}. Compare {{cog|nl|woord}}, {{cog|en|word}}, {{cog|da|ord}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/vɔrt/|[vɔʁt]|[ʋ-]|[-ɔɐ̯t]|[-ɔːt]}} * {{audio|de|De-Wort.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Wortes|gen2=Worts|Wörter|pl2=Worte|Wörtchen|dim2=Wörtlein}} # {{qualifier|plural '''{{m|de|Wörter}}'''}} [[word]] as an isolated unit #: {{ux|de|Im Deutschen gibt es wenig '''Wörter''', die mit y geschrieben werden.|In German there are few '''words''' spelt with y.}} # {{qualifier|plural '''{{m|de|Worte}}'''}} [[utterance]], [[word]] with context #: {{ux|de|Er erklärte das Problem mit wenigen '''Worten'''.|He explained the problem in few '''words'''.}} #: {{ux|de|Keiner wagte dem '''Wort''' des Königs zu widersprechen.|No one dared contradict the king's '''word'''.}} # {{lb|de|uncountable}} [[speech]], [[speaking]], {{gloss|figuratively}} [[floor]] #: {{ux|de|Er beherrscht unsere Sprache in '''Wort''' und Schrift.|He masters our language in '''speech''' and writing.}} #: {{ux|de|Der Präsident erteilte dem Abgeordneten das '''Wort'''.|The president gave the delegate the '''floor'''.}} # {{lb|de|uncountable}} [[promise]], {{gloss|figuratively}} [[word]] #: {{ux|de|Ich gebe dir mein '''Wort''', dass ich pünktlich da bin.|I give you my '''word''' that I shall be there on time.}} ====Usage notes==== * A clear distinction is usually made in the standard language between the plural forms {{m|de|Wörter}} and {{m|de|Worte}} (as above). Note, however, the compound {{m|de|Sprichwort||proverb}}, whose plural is more commonly {{m|de|Sprichwörter}} rather than the expected {{m|de|Sprichworte}}. Generally, the distinction is much less clear in colloquial German, where {{m|de||Worte}} is not seldom heard for sense 1, and {{m|de||Wörter}} is occasionally heard for sense 2. ====Declension====
